revised_title: The Cranial Nerves and Electric Nerves of the Torpedo
tldr: The author examines the cranial and electric nerves of the torpedo, comparing their arrangement and distribution to those of the skate. They identify the ophthalmicus profundus, trigeminus, facial complex, glossopharyngeus, and vagus complex, as well as the electric nerves that supply the electric organ. The study provides insights into the nervous system of elasmobranch fishes.
